lines.text: I'm stage manager here and this opera's going on tonight even if Frankenstein walks in.
Kelly, you stay here. It might do you a little good to meet a real detective.
[after a pause]
Ask Mr. Chan to come in.
Wait a minute! You haven't called Chop Suey in on the case? Have you, Chief?
No, but it's not a bad idea, and take your hat off! You could learn a little politeness from the Chinese too!
Honorable father once say, "Politeness golden key that open many doors."
I don't like that guy Borelli! I think he uses perfume!
Small things sometimes tell large story.
Say, I worked around sanitariums before. It's not so bad. I like the cuckoos myself. They're the same as anybody else, only they're smart enough to admit they're nuts.

[looking at a note written in Chinese]
What's that? A laundry list?
Much laundry, but all dirty.
Roses and romance like tenor in opera - sing most persuasive love song.
My name's Arnold. I'm stage manager here, and this opera is going on tonight even if Frankenstein walks in.
Man who ride on merry-go-round often enough finally catch brass ring.
Very old Chinese wise man once say, "Madness twin bvrother of genius because each live in world created by own ego. One sometimes mistaken for the other."
Case still wide open like swinging gate.
Watta yuh mean?
Gravelle not murderer.
Not Gravelle?
Excuse please, will demonstrate hypothesis.
What?
Word of Greek origin, hypo meaning...

[interrupting]
Hypo! I get it! He's hittin' the pipe again!
Is this some ridiculous attempt at saving your face, Mr. Chan?
Humble countenance merely facing facts.
[last lines]
I knew we were on the right track Pop! The first time I saw Madam Borelli, I was sure she was guilty, because...
[the visor on his helmet slams shut, cutting him off]
Case now closed.
Did you ever see a baritone you could trust?
[first lines]
What's the mater Joe? Nervous?
Aw this job gives me gooseflesh. You're new here, but in a couple of months you'll get as jumpy as me.
Hey I've worked around sanitariums before, it's not so bad. I like the cuckoos myself. They're the same as anyone else only they're smart enough to admit they're nuts.
